alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 4:44PM EDT until July 31 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Johnston and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Walnut Creek, Pine Level, Princeton, Pikeville, Seven Springs, Mar-Mac, Brogden, Elroy, Nahunta, Grantham and Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
